preface.title: Foreword: ${project.version}
preface.para: This book covers both Nexus Open Source and Nexus Professional, a product which brings full control and visibility to organizations which depend on Maven repositories to manage releases and distribute software. You are encouraged to check http://books.sonatype.com/nexus-book weekly for any updates to the content. If you would like to receive updates whenever there is a change to this user's manual, please send a quick note to support@sonatype.com, and we will gladly add your email to the update notification list.

We welcome your feedback, please do not hesitate to contact the Sonatype team with any questions or ideas you may have about the product. We're focused on making the adoption of Nexus Open Source and Nexus Professional painless, and we are here to do anything we can to help speed up the learning curve associated with some of the more advanced and powerful features of Nexus.

If you have any feedback or questions, you are encouraged to post an item in our Get Satisfaction page for this book: http://www.getsatisfaction.com/sonatype/products/sonatype_repository_management_with_nexus.

section.title: Changes in Edition 2.0
section.para: The following changes were introduced in Edition 2.0 on December 23, 2009:

listitem.para: Fixed a problem in . This section was pointing people at the wrong directory for Nexus plugin installation. Fixed a related bug in and in . (NXBOOK-394 and NXBOOK-374)

Separated introduction and explanation of repository management concepts into a separate chapter: . This change was made because the introduction was becoming too large to accomodate more straightforward material explaining Nexus. (NXBOOK-395)
Rewrote the introduction to focus on Sonatype Nexus.

Added sections to the introduction which list the licenses for Nexus Open Source and Nexus Professional. This was necessary because a few readers had thought that the Creative Commons license on the book was applying to all of Nexus. (NXBOOK-379) This isn't the case:
The book is Creative Commons NC-ND-BY.
Nexus Professional is available under a commercial license.
Added the feature matrix comparing Nexus Open Source to Nexus Professional to the introduction. (NXBOOK-369 and NXBOOK-368)
Updated the version of the Nexus Plugin Archetype from 1.0-SNAPSHOT to 1.2 in . (NXBOOK-375)
